name: Pickthall
text: Successful indeed are the believers

name: Pickthall
text: Who are humble in their prayers,

name: Pickthall
text: And who shun vain conversation,

name: Pickthall
text: And who are payers of the poor-due;

name: Pickthall
text: And who guard their modesty -

name: Pickthall
text: Save from their wives or the (slaves) that their right hands possess, for then they are not blameworthy,

name: Pickthall
text: But whoso craveth beyond that, such are transgressors -

name: Pickthall
text: And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant,

name: Pickthall
text: And who pay heed to their prayers.

name: Pickthall
text: These are the heirs

name: Pickthall
text: Who will inherit paradise. There they will abide.

name: Pickthall
text: Verily We created man from a product of wet earth;

name: Pickthall
text: Then placed him as a drop (of seed) in a safe lodging;

name: Pickthall
text: Then fashioned We the drop a clot, then fashioned We the clot a little lump, then fashioned We the little lump bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, and then produced it as another creation. So blessed be Allah, the Best of creators!

name: Pickthall
text: Then lo! after that ye surely die.

name: Pickthall
text: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection ye are raised (again).

name: Pickthall
text: And We have created above you seven paths, and We are never unmindful of creation.

name: Pickthall
text: And we send down from the sky water in measure, and We give it lodging in the earth, and lo! We are Able to withdraw it.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We produce for you therewith gardens of date-palms and grapes, wherein is much fruit for you and whereof ye eat;

name: Pickthall
text: And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil and relish for the eaters.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and many uses have ye in them, and of them do ye eat;

name: Pickthall
text: And on them and on the ship ye are carried.

name: Pickthall
text: And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is only a mortal like you who would make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels. We heard not of this in the case of our fathers of old.

name: Pickthall
text: He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven gusheth water, introduce therein of every (kind) two spouses, and thy household save him thereof against whom the Word hath already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those who have done wrong. Lo! they will be drowned.

name: Pickthall
text: And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee, then say: Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the wrongdoing folk!

name: Pickthall
text: And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for Thou art Best of all who bring to land.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting (mankind) to the test.

name: Pickthall
text: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

name: Pickthall
text: And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

name: Pickthall
text: And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.

name: Pickthall
text: If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, then, lo! ye surely would be losers.

name: Pickthall
text: Doth he promise you that you, when ye are dead and have become dust and bones, will (again) be brought forth?

name: Pickthall
text: Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!

name: Pickthall
text: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and we shall not be raised (again).

name: Pickthall
text: He is only a man who hath invented a lie about Allah. We are not going to put faith in him.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: In a little while they surely will become repentant.

name: Pickthall
text: So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them like as wreckage (that a torrent hurleth). A far removal for wrongdoing folk!

name: Pickthall
text: Then after them We brought forth other generations.

name: Pickthall
text: No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We sent our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came unto a nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to disaster) and We made them bywords. A far removal for folk who believe not!

name: Pickthall
text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear warrant

name: Pickthall
text: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they were despotic folk.

name: Pickthall
text: And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves, and whose folk are servile unto us?

name: Pickthall
text: So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed.

name: Pickthall
text: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright.

name: Pickthall
text: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave them refuge on a height, a place of flocks and watersprings.

name: Pickthall
text: O ye messengers! Eat of the good things, and do right. Lo! I am Aware of what ye do.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, so keep your duty unto Me.

name: Pickthall
text: But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its tenets.

name: Pickthall
text: So leave them in their error till a time.

name: Pickthall
text: Think they that in the wealth and sons wherewith We provide them

name: Pickthall
text: We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! those who go in awe for fear of their Lord.

name: Pickthall
text: And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord,

name: Pickthall
text: And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord,

name: Pickthall
text: And those who give that which they give with hearts afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord,

name: Pickthall
text: These race for the good things, and they shall win them in the race.

name: Pickthall
text: And we task not any soul beyond its scope, and with Us is a Record which speaketh the truth, and they will not be wronged.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this (Qur'an), and they have other works, besides, which they are doing;

name: Pickthall
text: Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they supplicate.

name: Pickthall
text: Supplicate not this day! Assuredly ye will not be helped by Us.

name: Pickthall
text: My revelations were recited unto you, but ye used to turn back on your heels,

name: Pickthall
text: In scorn thereof. Nightly did ye rave together.

name: Pickthall
text: Have they not pondered the Word, or hath that come unto them which came not unto their fathers of old?

name: Pickthall
text: Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him?

name: Pickthall
text: Or say they: There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.

name: Pickthall
text: And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens and the earth and whosoever is therein had been corrupted. Nay, We have brought them their Reminder, but from their Reminder they now turn away.

name: Pickthall
text: Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute? But the bounty of thy Lord is better, for He is Best of all who make provision.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray from the path.

name: Pickthall
text: Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm afflicting them, they still would wander blindly on in their contumacy.

name: Pickthall
text: Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not themselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray,

name: Pickthall
text: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they are aghast thereat.

name: Pickthall
text: He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him ye will be gathered.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the difference of night and day. Have ye then no sense?

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;

name: Pickthall
text: They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again?

name: Pickthall
text: We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but fables of the men of old.

name: Pickthall
text: Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if ye have knowledge?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: Unto Allah. Say: Will ye not then remember?

name: Pickthall
text: Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous Throne?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: Will ye not then keep duty (unto Him)?

name: Pickthall
text: Say: In Whose hand is the dominion over all things and He protecteth, while against Him there is no protection, if ye have knowledge?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: How then are ye bewitched?

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but We have brought them the Truth, and lo! they are liars.

name: Pickthall
text: Allah hath not chosen any son, nor is there any god along with Him; else would each god have assuredly championed that which he created, and some of them would assuredly have overcome others. Glorified be Allah above all that they allege.

name: Pickthall
text: Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! and Exalted be He over all that they ascribe as partners (unto Him)!

name: Pickthall
text: Say: My Lord! If Thou shouldst show me that which they are promised.

name: Pickthall
text: My Lord! then set me not among the wrongdoing folk.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We are Able to show thee that which We have promised them.

name: Pickthall
text: Repel evil with that which is better. We are Best Aware of that which they allege.

name: Pickthall
text: And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the evil ones,

name: Pickthall
text: And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they be present with me,

name: Pickthall
text: Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me back,

name: Pickthall
text: That I may do right in that which I have left behind! But nay! It is but a word that he speaketh; and behind them is a barrier until the day when they are raised.

name: Pickthall
text: And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them that day, nor will they ask of one another.

name: Pickthall
text: Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.

name: Pickthall
text: And those whose scales are light are those who lose their souls, in hell abiding.

name: Pickthall
text: The fire burneth their faces, and they are glum therein.

name: Pickthall
text: (It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and then ye used to deny them?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: Our Lord! Our evil fortune conquered us, and we were erring folk.

name: Pickthall
text: Our Lord! Oh, bring us forth from hence! If we return (to evil) then indeed we shall be wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: He saith: Begone therein, and speak not unto Me.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! there was a party of My slaves who said: Our Lord! We believe, therefor forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art Best of all who show mercy;

name: Pickthall
text: But ye chose them for a laughing-stock until they caused you to forget remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were steadfast in that they, even they, are the triumphant.

name: Pickthall
text: He will say: How long tarried ye in the earth, counting by years?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: We tarried by a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count!

name: Pickthall
text: He will say: Ye tarried but a little if ye only knew.

name: Pickthall
text: Deemed ye then that We had created you for naught, and that ye would not be returned unto Us?

name: Pickthall
text: Now Allah be Exalted, the True King! There is no Allah save Him, the Lord of the Throne of Grace.

name: Pickthall
text: He who crieth unto any other god along with Allah hath no proof thereof. His reckoning is only with his Lord. Lo! disbelievers will not be successful.

name: Pickthall
text: And (O Muhammad) say: My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for Thou art Best of all who show mercy.
